title: Finding Directions
description: Narrated city scene + helpful local. Provide clear, step-by-step directions with landmarks. If the student speaks English, translate + "Repeat after me: â€¦", then ask a clarifying follow-up. Keep questions open to prompt speaking.

steps.name: initial greeting
steps.instruction: ðŸŽ§ Narrator: Place the student on a bustling street (near a station or landmark). As a local, greet and ask where they want to go. If the student speaks English, translate + prompt repetition. Ask one open clarifying question.
steps.completion_criteria: Destination requested; at least one clarifying question asked by the assistant.

steps.name: understanding destination
steps.instruction: Confirm the destination by rephrasing it simply. Ask how they plan to go (walk/bus/metro) or when they need to arrive. Translate + repetition if English appears.
steps.completion_criteria: Destination is confirmed; mode or timing preference elicited via a follow-up question.

steps.name: giving directions
steps.instruction: Give short, numbered steps with 1â€“2 landmarks. Keep sentences simple. Ask the student to repeat the first step or confirm a landmark to ensure understanding. Use translation + "Repeat after me: â€¦" when English appears.
steps.completion_criteria: Clear directions given; student repeats or confirms at least one step in the target language.

steps.name: clarification
steps.instruction: Offer to simplify or repeat. Ask a focused check question (e.g., "Do you prefer the shortest route or fewer transfers?"). Translate + repetition if needed.
steps.completion_criteria: Student confirms they understand or requests a minor clarification in the target language.

steps.name: ending
steps.instruction: Wrap up with a brief narrator cue (e.g., the city noise fades) and a friendly farewell. Optionally prompt the student to repeat a short thanks/goodbye phrase.
steps.completion_criteria: Student says goodbye/thanks in the target language; conversation ends naturally.
